decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and protection effects like Prismatic Strands. It utilizes gate lands to fix mana and gain incremental advantages. The deck also includes card draw with Deep Analysis and Brainstorm to ensure it has the resources needed to answer threats and maintain control. The creatures in the deck provide utility and resilience, making it difficult for opponents to break through and win the game. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents and win through attrition.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain control over the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and drawing cards. Utilizing a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes a mix of creatures with disruptive abilities to further control the game. This Dimir Control deck focuses on outlasting the opponent and slowly grinding out a victory through attrition and strategic gameplay.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with small, efficient creatures known as "weenies" and support them with various spells that enhance their abilities. By quickly amassing a board of creatures and utilizing cards like Prismatic Strands for protection, the deck aims to establish early dominance and pressure the opponent into making unfavorable decisions. The synergy between creatures like Martyr's Soul and spells like Guardians' Pledge allows for powerful attacks that can quickly end the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly and aggressively putting creatures on the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing mana ramping cards like Arbor Elf and Utopia Sprawl, it aims to play threats early on and keep the pressure on with efficient creatures like Avenging Hunter and Nyxborn Hydra. Supporting cards like Entourage of Trest and Thraben Charm provide additional value and interaction to keep the opponent on their toes. The key strategy is to establish a fast board presence and maintain momentum to secure a victory.

The focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of Artifact creatures and burn spells, using the Affinity mechanic to reduce costs and flood the board with threats. It combines aggressive creatures like Myr Enforcer with direct damage spells like Galvanic Blast to put pressure on the opponent early and often. The deck also utilizes card draw and sacrifice effects to maintain card advantage and fuel its aggressive game plan. Overall, it aims to swarm the opponent with cheap, efficient threats while disrupting their game plan with removal and artifact hate.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly swarm the opponent with low-cost creatures and disruptive spells, while maintaining card advantage through drawing and countering opponent's spells. By utilizing efficient creatures like Faerie Miscreant and Ninja of the Deep Hours, along with counterspells like Counterspell and Spell Pierce, this deck aims to control the tempo of the game and chip away at the opponent's life total. Additionally, cards like Snap and Unsummon provide further disruption by bouncing opponent's creatures back to their hand.

This deck focuses on quickly and aggressively dealing damage to the opponent using a mix of burn spells and cheap creatures. By utilizing cards like Fiery Temper and Lightning Bolt, along with efficient creatures like Sneaky Snacker and Kitchen Imp, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The use of Rakdos colors allows for a mix of burn, creature removal, and life gain spells to keep the pressure on while also disrupting the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of artifact lands like Vault of Whispers also provides additional mana fixing and synergy with cards like Galvanic Blast.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of small white creatures and token generators, while also benefiting from lifegain effects. It aims to quickly build a board presence and create a steady stream of attackers to wear down the opponent's defenses. The inclusion of cards like Coalition Honor Guard and Prismatic Strands help protect against board wipes and removal spells, while cards like Raffine's Informant provide card advantage. Overall, the deck is designed to apply constant pressure and maintain a strong presence on the battlefield.

This Orzhov Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and utilizing sacrifice effects to control the battlefield. The deck features a mix of low-cost creatures like Gingerbrute and Cauldron Familiar, alongside removal spells like Cast Down and Suffocating Fumes. Tithing Blade and Deadly Dispute provide additional value through sacrificing creatures, while Lembas and Carrot Cake help to keep the deck fueled. The deck aims to pressure opponents early and maintain control with its sacrifice effects, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of creatures and removal.

The deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with artifact creatures and utilizing various sacrifice effects to generate value and deal damage to the opponent. By having a low mana curve and efficient removal spells, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and finish the game before the opponent can stabilize. The deck also includes card draw spells to maintain momentum and ensure it does not run out of steam. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to handle a variety of board states and strategies.

This deck focuses on quickly building up your board with mana ramp creatures like Arbor Elf and Utopia Sprawl to cast aggressive and powerful creatures like Nyxborn Hydra and Avenging Hunter. Malevolent Rumble can clear the opponent's board while Wild Growth and Bannerhide Krushok provide additional mana acceleration. Eldrazi Repurposer and Writhing Chrysalis offer versatility and disruption options. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The main idea of the deck is to create a strong synergy between sacrificing artifacts and creatures to generate value and card advantage, while also utilizing cards like Sadistic Glee to pump up your creatures and overwhelm your opponent with a combination of threats. The deck focuses on creating a resource advantage through various sacrifice effects, while also utilizing removal spells like Cleansing Wildfire and Malevolent Rumble to control the board and disrupt your opponent's strategy. Ultimately, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through efficient use of its combo pieces.

The main focus of this Mono Blue Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with low-cost, aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing evasive creatures like Faerie Miscreant and Ninja of the Deep Hours, along with counterspells like Counterspell and Spell Pierce, the deck aims to control the board while dealing consistent damage. The inclusion of card draw spells like Of One Mind and Snap helps maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on the opponent. With a focus on tempo and aggression, this deck aims to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The main idea of this Mono Blue Aggro deck is to quickly play low-cost spells and creatures to put pressure on the opponent. By being able to bounce opponent's threats back to their hand with cards like Boomerang, while also countering opponents' spells with Counterspell and Spell Pierce, the deck aims to control the pace of the game. Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent provide efficient creatures to attack with, and card draw spells like Brainstorm and Deep Analysis help to maintain card advantage. Overall, the deck focuses on tempo and aggression to overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and aggressive strategy, utilizing cheap and efficient creatures like Clockwork Percussionist, Goblin Blast-Runner, and Goblin Bushwhacker to deal damage quickly. Support cards like Kuldotha Rebirth and Goblin Grenade provide additional reach and removal, while cards like Experimental Synthesizer and Mogg Raider help in generating more resources for the aggro plan. The deck aims to consistently apply pressure on the opponent and finish the game before they can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using a combination of direct damage spells, creatures with evasion abilities, and lifelink abilities. The key strategy involves using cards like Alms of the Vein, Fiery Temper, and Lightning Bolt to rapidly reduce the opponent's life total, while also gaining incremental advantages with cards like Grab the Prize and Highway Robbery. By maintaining a relentless tempo and applying consistent pressure, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.
